guys very easy to fix Audio out of synch:
1. run the movie in VLC 
2. on a mac just press "G" (windows k) like 5 times or so till it says 350ms then it's in Synch.

FYI - In General Mac "f" & "G" Windows "J" and "K" for moving audio track back or forward 50ms per tap

Oh no, the end of the world :P. Abuse is bad, but I do find it funny how people try to humanize them.

I see lots of comments about the audio sync and people responding with "use f and g to sync with VLC", which is good advice in general, but *will not work* with this film.  The issue here is that the audio delay is actually changing relative to the movie as the film plays (for me the delay ranged from 300ms to -50ms), not to mention the cave-like sound quality to begin with.  So I'd recommend trying another version even for VLC users...
